snippet: North Korea said on Tuesday that it will release prisoners in its first special pardon since 2005, as the country escalated efforts to build support for its new leader, Kim Jong-un.
abstract: North Korea says it will release prisoners in its first special amnesty in seven years; pardons come as country escalates a campaign to consolidate support for its new leader, Kim Jong-un.
lead_paragraph: North Korea said on Tuesday that it will release prisoners in its first special pardon since 2005, as the country escalated efforts to build support for its new leader, Kim Jong-un.

headline.main: North Korea Announces It Will Release Prisoners
headline.print_headline: North Korea Announces It Will Release Prisoners

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
